results.title: The Crime of Mr Lange = Le Crime de Monsieur Lange
results.creator_credit: Jean Renoir, Andre Halley des Fontaines and Oberon
results.brief_description: Lange is an author of wild west novels. When the owner of the company that publishes Lange’s works absconds with the company funds, Lange rallies the employees together to create their own publishing house. The publisher returns, disguised as a priest, and demands a share of the profits. Lange responds by killing him. The grateful employees help Lange to escape prosecution, allowing him to leave the country with his lovely fiancee. It is a joyous film, just as the Popular Front was a joyous movement, happy in the belief that living and working conditions could be changed for the better and fascism resisted at home and abroad. Exploitation (including sexual exploitation) are represented as the product of authoritarian capitalism, represented here by the publisher. Cast includes Rene Lefevre, Jules Berry, Florelle and Nadia Sibirkskaia. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: The Craic
results.creator_credit: Ted Emery, Jimeoin McKeown, Marc Gracie, David Foster, Australian Film Commission, Geffer Notice, Foster Gracie and Crack Pty Ltd
results.brief_description: Craic is Irish slang for a laugh or a good time, which is what this comedy about two Irishmen on the run in Australia is all about. Fergus (Jimeoin) and his best friend Wesley (Alan McKee) are living in Belfast when they incur the wrath of violent IRA leader, Colin (Robert Morgan). Since Ireland no longer seems like a safe place to stay, they head for Sydney, where they manage to find work despite not having the necessary work permits. Fergus gets a chance to appear on TVs “The Dating Game” and wins a vacation to Queensland. However immigration authorities become aware of the friends’ illegal status and Wesley tracks down Fergus, just in time to meet up with Colin who has come to Australia as part of the witness protection program. Thus a mad chase ensues as Fergus and Wesley head for the outback with immigration agents, secret service men and IRA renegades hot on their trail.

results.title: The creative power of TikTok duets
results.material_description: Digital screen recording of @vixey_co18 Tiktok video
results.brief_description: Tiktok user @KateyLorrell had humble aspirations for her now-famous video: “just trying to show my fit off, but the good lord had other plans, ” she wrote in the caption of a video of her tripping in her room. Other plans indeed: her spill now has millions of views through Tiktok ‘duets’, a feature which allows users to repost a video alongside a video accompaniment of their own, making comedy out of her (minor) misfortune.
results.description:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

TikTok user @KateyLorrell had humble aspirations for her now-famous video: “just trying to show my fit off, but the good lord had other plans, ” she wrote in the caption of a video of her tripping in her room. Other plans indeed: her spill now has millions of views through TikTok ‘duets’, a feature which allows users to repost a video alongside a video accompaniment of their own, making comedy out of her (minor) misfortune.

results.title: The Civil War. Episode 6, 1864--valley of the shadow of death
results.creator_credit: Ric Burns, Ken Burns, WETA-TV and Florentine Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “The Civil War”.
For three years Robert E. Lee has met, measured and defeated a string of Union generals, but now Lincoln elevates Ulysses S. Grant to commander of all Union armies and brings him east to face the brilliant Lee. In a month-long series of battles, Grant’s army loses an appalling 50,000 men, but, heedless of the carnage he drives his superior numbers towards Richmond until halted at Petersburg. Meanwhile Sherman relentlessly advances to Atlanta, until he too is halted. Time is running out for Lincoln.

results.title: Tintin in Tibet
results.creator_credit: Stephane Bernasconi, Foundation Herge, Nelvana and Ellipse
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Adventures of Tintin”.
When Tintin reads a newspaper report of a Nepalese air disaster, little does he know that his vacation is about to take him to the Himalayas and adventure! Tintin’s dear friend Chang is aboard the crashed plane and although there are no reported survivors, Tintin is sure that Chang is alive. With Captain Haddock’s help they battle blizzards and the Yeti to find Chang.

results.title: Traditions
results.creator_credit: Con Bell, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Conscription brought Con Bell into World War II. Regardless of how he entered the war, Con is proud of the part he played in the development of a new army tradition. A member of the first permanent commando squadrons, he reflects on how this experience has shaped the man he is today.

results.title: The Civil War. Episode 5, 1863--the universe of battle
results.creator_credit: Ken Burns, Ric Burns, WETA-TV and Florentine Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “The Civil War”.
Feeling invincible after the spring’s great victories Lee drives north to Gettysburg and three of the most crucial days of the war. 51,000 men fall, one in every three, and when the firing dies, General Lee is in retreat, never again to threaten the North. Grant seizes Vicksburg and the rebels are soundly defeated in Tennessee, but the first military draft provokes a series of anti-war, anti-black riots. Scarcely noticed in all the hubbub is Lincoln’s visit to Gettysburg and the address in which he defines the Union and the war in a mere 269 words.

results.title: The Civil War
results.creator_credit: Ken Burns, Ric Burns, WETA-TV and Florentine Films
results.brief_description: The first full-scale documentary of the conflict that cost 620,000 lives and redefined the meaning of “freedom” in America. The story is largely told through a huge number and variety of archival photographs, with a sound track composed of a narration by David McCullough and readings by a distinguished cast from writings of the participants, interspersed with commentaries by historians and other experts, most notably with Shelby Foote and Barbara Fields. The voices include those of Sam Waterston, Julie Harris, Jason Robards and Morgan Freeman with Derek Jacobi, Jeremy Irons and Kurt Vonnegut.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ken Burns, Ric Burns, WETA-TV and Florentine Films
